channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ソニー・インディアのNP・シン代表が、Zeeとの合併が破綻した数ヵ月後に、年齢と個人的な理由を理由に退任する予定であることが明らかになった。
item.description:
Variety:
Sony India's head NP Singh plans to step down months after merger with Zee collapsed, citing age and personal reasons; Singh has been with SPNI for 25 years  —  NP Singh, the well-respected head of Sony's entertainment businesses in India, is to step down.  —  The announcement was made on Friday local time.

item.title: 英国、メディア法案を可決、出版社に勝訴・敗訴にかかわらず裁判費用の全額負担を義務付けた未制定の犯罪・裁判所法第40条を廃止（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
UK passes the Media Bill, repealing the not-yet-enacted Section 40 of the Crime and Courts Act, which required publishers to pay all court costs, win or lose  —  The Media Bill has been passed removing the threat of state-backed press regulation and modernising broadcasting regulations for the streaming age.

item.title: 2023年下半期にNetflixで最も視聴されたタイトルは『Leave the World Behind』で、1億2100万回再生され、最も視聴されたシリーズは『ONE PIECE』で、7160万回再生された（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Leave the World Behind was the most-watched title on Netflix globally in H2 2023, with 121M views, while One Piece was the most-watched series, with 71.6M views  —  Dystopian thriller “Leave the World Behind” was the most-watched film — and title overall — on Netflix globally in the second half of 2023 …

item.title: メディア・マターズ、十数人のスタッフを解雇 法的措置に対する防衛とメディア状況の変化を理由に（Ted Johnson/Deadline）
item.description:
Ted Johnson / Deadline:
Media Matters lays off over a dozen staffers, citing its defense against legal action and the shifting media landscape  —  Media Matters for America, the progressive watchdog journalism organization, underwent a round of layoffs today, as its president cited the shifting media landscape as well as its defense against legal action.

item.title: パラマウントとチャーターが新たな複数年契約を結び、2024年後半にチャーター加入者に広告付き版「Paramount+」と「BET+」を無料配信（The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
The Hollywood Reporter:
Paramount and Charter reach a new multiyear carriage deal, adding the ad-supported versions of Paramount+ and BET+ for free to Charter subscribers later in 2024  —  The news comes at a critical moment for the entertainment company.

item.title: トランプ氏、当選すればロシアはWSJのエヴァン・ガーシュコビッチ記者を釈放すると発言、クレムリンはこの件でのプーチン大統領とトランプ氏の接触を否定（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Trump says that if he's elected, Russia would release WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich; the Kremlin denies any contact between Putin and Trump on the matter  —  Kremlin says Russian leader isn't in contact with former U.S. president about journalist  —  Former President Donald Trump …

item.title: ライオンズゲート第4四半期：前年同期9,680万ドルの損失に対し3,950万ドルの純損失、全体の売上は11億1,700万ドル、Starzのストリーミング加入者は1,259万人で、第3四半期の1,263万人から減少（Etan Vlessing/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Etan Vlessing / The Hollywood Reporter:
Lionsgate Q4: a net loss of $39.5M vs. a loss of $96.8M a year ago, overall revenue of $1.117B; Starz had 12.59M streaming subscribers, down from 12.63M in Q3  —  The latest quarterly earnings follows a spin of its studio business into a separately traded company, Lionsgate Studios.

item.title: アニタ・ヒルが会長を務める擁護団体「ハリウッド・コミッション」が、エンターテインメント業界の労働者が職場の虐待を報告するためのウェブサイト「マイコネクスト」を開設（Selena Kuznikov/Variety）
item.description:
Selena Kuznikov / Variety:
Hollywood Commission, an advocacy organization chaired by Anita Hill, launches MyConnext, a website for entertainment industry workers to report workplace abuse  —  Since the #MeToo movement began gained momentum in Hollywood back in 2017, entertainment workers have voiced concerns …

item.title: ベン・スミスとネイマ・ラザは、5月31日にメディアに関するポッドキャスト「Mixed Signals」を開始する予定。
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
Ben Smith and Nayeema Raza plan to launch Mixed Signals, a podcast about media, on May 31, sponsored by Google and available as audio-only and on YouTube  —  Sponsored by Google, the show will be available as an audio-only production and as a video offering on YouTube  —  Welcome back to Soundbite.

item.title: 情報筋AlphabetとMetaがハリウッドスタジオとAI動画生成ツール用コンテンツのライセンスについて協議、DisneyとNetflixはライセンスに応じず（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Sources: Alphabet and Meta have talked to Hollywood studios about licensing content for AI video generation tools; Disney and Netflix aren't willing to license  —  - Studios seek to harness AI's promise without losing control  — Warner weighs licensing content; Disney, Netflix say no

item.title: 悪いニュースだ：私は12人の同僚とともに@mmfaを解雇された。極右の億万長者が弁護士軍団を引き連れてメディア・マターズを攻撃するのには理由がある：彼らは私たちの仕事がいかに効果的かを知っており、それが彼ら（彼）を恐怖に陥れている。(キャット・アブ/@abughazalehkat)
item.description:
Kat Abu / @abughazalehkat:
Bad News: I've been laid off from @mmfa, along with a dozen colleagues. There's a reason far-right billionaires attack Media Matters with armies of lawyers: They know how effective our work is, and it terrifies them (him).

item.title: ニュース出版社とAI企業との既存の取引の概要と、長期的なコストや選定プロセスなどに関する疑問点（Pete Brown/Columbia Journalism Review）
item.description:
Pete Brown / Columbia Journalism Review:
An overview of existing deals between news publishers and AI companies and the questions they raise regarding long-term costs, the selection process, and more  —  In the past few weeks, News Corp, the Financial Times and Dotdash Meredith became the latest news organizations to strike licensing deals …

item.title: 英国の競争監視機関であるCMAを強化する法案が承認に向かう。CMAは、テック大手に対し、自社サイトにリンクされたニュースの対価を出版社に支払うよう働きかけることができる（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
A bill strengthening the CMA, UK's competition watchdog, heads toward approval; the CMA could push tech giants to pay publishers for news linked on their sites  —  The UK has paved the way for Australia-style payments to news publishers from tech giants as the Digital Markets, Competition and Consumers Bill was passed by Parliament.

item.title: 司法省と30州の司法長官がチケットマスターの親会社ライブ・ネイションを提訴、「独占的支配を行使するための反競争的行為」と主張（CNBC）
item.description:
CNBC:
The DOJ and 30 state AGs sue Ticketmaster parent company Live Nation to break it up, alleging “anticompetitive conduct to exercise its monopolistic control”  —  The U.S. Department of Justice is suing to break up Live Nation, the parent company of Ticketmaster, over alleged antitrust violations.

item.title: 2023年4月、AIが作成したシューマッハのインタビューを掲載したドイツのタブロイド紙「Die Aktuelle」に対し、ミハエル・シューマッハの遺族が勝訴（AP通信）。
item.description:
Associated Press:
Michael Schumacher's family wins its legal case against German tabloid Die Aktuelle that published an AI-generated interview with Schumacher in April 2023  —  - Die Aktuelle promoted 2023 piece that ‘sounds deceptively real’  — Publisher had sacked editor and apologised to F1 great's family
